Counter Malign Influence: Strategies, Insights, and Tools

Course Description This course is designed to equip students with the skills to analyze and combat misinformation, disinformation, and malinformation (MDM) using data analytics and critical thinking. By the end of this course, students will gain hands-on experience in data acquisition, cleaning, exploration, visualization, and analysis with a strong focus on real-world applications.

This course is intended for part-time participation and is structured to be flexible for those balancing additional commitments, such as school, work, or other responsibilities. While it provides a rigorous foundation in misinformation analysis, the workload is designed to be manageable alongside other obligations, ensuring that students can engage meaningfully without requiring a full-time commitment.

Capstone

Learning Objectives By the end of this course, students will:

  • Develop critical thinking skills to evaluate and combat MDM.

  • Gain hands-on experience with Python-based data analytics tools.

  • Learn to identify patterns in data using real-world datasets.

  • Understand counter-MDM strategies and policy implications.

  • Present actionable insights based on their analysis.

Course Materials

  • Datasets & Case Studies: Provided within Jupyter Notebooks and assignments.

  • External Readings: Supplementary reports and academic papers on MDM.
